place.name: Arroyo Quemado Transect 2
place.geographicDescription: Transect transverses slightly southeast across the prominent east/west ridges. Bedrock substrate with some moderate relief (0-1.5 m). Depth is approximately 24'.
place.completeDescription: Located 20m at 80 degrees from TR1-40m bolt. The 0m bolt lies 1m past base of small (0.5m relief) ledge. Transect transverses slightly southeast across the prominent east/west ridges. Bedrock substrate with some moderate relief (0-1.5m). All markers are SS ¼” eyebolts with tubing. The 0 and 40m are marked with yellow rebar and bumpers. 8m bolt is on the lip of a ridge. Transect heading is 90 degrees.

verbatim.notesInfoReceived: ~50 PTJ; 90% rock; no adult kelp; DL, APCA, YOY rockfish; PTJ, POLA, DIOR, SPL, BLD, and EC common; Large urchin band moving across transect; Large areas of 3-5cm DIAT; 32-40m has 100% DL cover.
90% rock; 10 PTCA; ~100 kelp plants; lots of DL, PACA; moderate red algae
